dt: {bc}of, relating to, or resembling the {d_link|Stoics|stoic:1} or their doctrines
{bc}not affected by or showing passion or feeling
{bc}firmly restraining response to pain or distress

pt: {sc}impassive{/sc} {sc}stoic{/sc} {sc}phlegmatic{/sc} {sc}apathetic{/sc} {sc}stolid{/sc} mean unresponsive to something that might normally excite interest or emotion. {sc}impassive{/sc} stresses the absence of any external sign of emotion in action or facial expression.

pt.t: met the news with an {it}impassive{/it} look

pt: {sc}stoic{/sc} implies an apparent indifference to pleasure or especially to pain often as a matter of principle or self-discipline.
{sc}phlegmatic{/sc} implies a temperament or constitution hard to arouse.
{sc}apathetic{/sc} may imply a puzzling or deplorable indifference or inertness.
{sc}stolid{/sc} implies a habitual absence of interest, responsiveness, or curiosity.

quotes.t: My {qword}stoic{/qword} Serbian brother-in-law, Aleksandar Vasilic, gave me the ultimate confidence booster of bawling all the way through the manuscript when I gave it to him to read.
Grant recorded his thought-experiment when he was an old man dying of cancer, who in spite of his pain had managed to achieve a {qword}stoical{/qword} serenity.

As it flew past the pole, a three-run homer, Richardson saw the {qword}stoical{/qword} Berra do something he'd never seen him do. "Halfway between home and first, he was jumping up and down," Richardson recalls. "Boy, was he happy to hit that ball!"

shortdef: of, relating to, or resembling the Stoics or their doctrines
not affected by or showing passion or feeling; especially : firmly restraining response to pain or distress
